page.title: 14AIR SPACE-CATTERICK-TUNSTALL
page.content: The only military land cover in this area is an army storage unit. However, the air space is regularly used by the aircraft of both the R.A.F. and the Army. Jets, light aircraft, gliders, helicopters and barrage balloons are quite common sights. Military personnel of all ranks purchase their own homes here as both R.A.F. Catterick and the Army garrison are only a short journey away. A three year posting seems to be the norm in forces life and this means that there is a constant changing of the population and if a complete regiment is posted abroad the property market is flooded with houses for sale or to let. All this has an unsettling effect on the community, particularly in the schools as it tends to disrupt class project work.
